comment: I disagree with all the negative reviews here. While Professor Schwartz may lecture fast, he cares a lot for his students and is very accessible outside of class. Plus, in class he gives you a minimum of 15 extra credit points per exam, so definitely go. For his exams, they're all identical to his old exams, which he provides. Would take again 100%

Good professor, very smart. Can over complicate some things in class and focuses on theorems a lot. Homeworks are exactly like the exams so do the homeworks you've done the exams. Attendance is not required but he does take note of who's showing up and who isn't. Actually wants you to learn rather than just pass. Tests have a lot of extra credit

His teaching style is a little sporadic. That said, everything he covers in class matches nearly exactly to the homework which then matches the tests. Very fun and very helpful if you need extra help. This class feels like a mix between statistics and econ.

This class is not easy and he doesn't always do the BEST job of explaining how to do certain problems that will be on the test so DEFINITELY come to class. However, he has a flexible grading policy and he is helpful outside of class. He's a nice guy and he cares so I would recommend him for sure.

Does not show you how to solve problems. Just gives answers with no explanations. When you go to office hours he doesn't want to deal with you if you do not understand how to solve math. He should be showing real application of math. Only three test grades

Great professor but a very difficult course. You'll want to be at every lecture and study the homework for the tests since they're identical. You really have to apply what you learned in class to succeed but thankfully the past exams that he posts on D2L help with homework stuff.

I have NEVER had to drop a class before but Schwartz is literally the worst math teacher I have ever had. Your final grade is made up of only 3 tests but you can swap one test grade with your HW grade, but its impossible to complete the hw when he only goes over theorems in class and not how to complete problems. Office hours are a waste of time!

Dr.Schwartz is by far the best professor I've had at KSU. He really pushes for understanding , and I have left every class I have taken of his with a better understanding of the field of economics and insurance.
Not a Easy A, but definitely worth taking this class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Dr. Schwartz is one of my favorite professors at KSU. He is passionate about economics and truly helps students understand why the math works how it does. This class can be difficult, especially if you are coming from a base in finance rather than economics, but I think it is very fun math, especially if you put in the work.

Schwartz is amazing! His homework is straightforward and is very similar to his lecture material. Often references the textbook, but not required to purchase. He has practice exams that WILL prepare you for the test. Homework is optional, but also super useful to help prep for exam. Attend class and you'll get an A or B!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: DO NOT TAKE INS4500!!! This was by far the hardest class I have taken in my entirety of college. Content/lectures are all theoretical and homework is all implementation. You will rarely be shown how to complete the homework!! Instead, you will be shown the theory behind the concepts and rarely see them implemented, leaving homework to be impossible
please don't take this class
This guy sucks but cracks a few jokes here and there. Overall, worst class of my life and I dreaded going to his class every day.

Funny professor who's passionate about econ applications but prone to lengthy tangents; posts lecture ppts and other materials. Strict about weekly HW: takes up physical copies at the end of class, but gives answer keys and therefore no late work is accepted (tho he drops 2 lowest HW grades). Some extra credit opportunities, and clear test outlines
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Prof Schwartz is an excellent Professor for Microeconomics. He is wonderful at explaining many of the widely complex material that this class covers. He is very knowledgable in his material, he is a clear and straight forward grader, and he is a very sweet man who gives insightful lectures. Take him and you will not regret it !
Schwartz is fantastic. He is a solid choice for Econ, especially if you are not confident in the material. He's extremely flexible and accommodating. Loves Econ and is super supportive.

I don't understand how he doesn't have a higher rating because he is an amazing professor. He is so smart and really cares about his students. If you don't understand something just ask, he will easily help you! He is definitely one of my favorite professors I have taken while being at Kennesaw.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Schwartz is a great guy. He really does care about each one of his students and wants to make sure they understand the material. He may ramble on a little in some lectures, but he really is a great teacher. He tells you what is going to be on the test and even gives extra credit. I would easily take him again.

Dr. Schwartz is one of the smartest professors I've met at KSU. He's the only professor that teaches Microeconomics 4510, so if it's a required course for you but you're not comfortable taking this class as it requires dedication (studying and read) and attending class then you've picked the wrong major. Go to his office hours, they're beneficial!!

Prof truly does love Economics. His humor is a bit dry, but the class is good. There's nothing on the tests that isn't in the notes, and he explains everything in detail. If you're lost, just ask. If you miss class, hes extremely willing to work with you. There is one homework assignment per week, but it directly mirrors that weeks' notes.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This class was the hardest class I have taken. The one I took was an Honors Econ 2100.. Let's just say it was horrible. Often times he goes off about random things, but he is a really good guy and is available for tutoring variety of times. Hard class but nice professor. Gives 3 tests and HW was 25% of grade (easy 100). Gives extra credit too.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Schwartz is a great professor. He will go over things in his office with you if you struggle. He is very knowledgeable of economics. If you struggle in this class, an economics degree is not for you. It is challenging, but not anything that a hard working intelligent person could not handle.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: BORING, and he has an... interesting or maybe nonexistent sense of humor and his lectures make me want to fall asleep! My advice. DONT. He grades really hard especially on neatness. Just save yourself the trouble. But if your stuck with this guy then do the homework and read his power points and you might make it out alive.

This class is talked about by many professors. It's challenging and absolutely worth the struggle. The only students I saw do poorly were ones who didn't do the homework. He gives homework that's 25% of your grade and rest is evenly split between 3 tests. If you do the work, visit his office, and study you'll make it. Hard class but worth it.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: When you get to upper level economics, nothing is going to be easy. Professor Schwartz has high expectations for his students and won't let you just slide by. He's a tough grader, but when you're mixing Calculus with economics how can you not be? Go to class, sit up front, visit him in his office and you'll make it. I learned a lot from this class.

Despite the poor reviews if you are an honors or AP student, this class will seem the same. He has a quirky personality that I found hilarious and had a lot of personal stories. Math-centered class but if you spend some time it's easy to get an A.

If you actually want to learn microeconomics at an intermediate level take him. He has his goofy quirks but you will develop a strong foundation for economics. This isnt a 2000 level class so it wont be a walk in the park, but it is extremely doable. His homework each week is structured like the exam and he gave the answers for the prior year exam.

This class had 2 tests, 1 non-cumulative final, and weekly homework assignments. The homework is more difficult in this class than in others -- he uses Aplia. He is available for help if you ask. The class is well organized and he explains things very clearly.

Professor Schwartz is the worst thing I have ever experienced, and I have seen some stuff. His voice can be compared to the dolorous groanings of a dying beast of burden and his tests are akin to waterboarding. He is not a good lecturer and his expectations are unclear.

Very straight forward if you attend class. Has good lectures and notes. Tests are OK must work every problem, homework is lengthy,checks all your work. However don't expect ANY amount of leniency even if your dying he doesn't care and will not allow you to make up assignments, even with legit proof he has no sympathy. Demeanor can be condescending

An awful teacher; he is very boring and condescending. He teaches poorly, taking much time on simple topics but glosses over hard concepts. Tests are hard when compared to the homework and to what is covered in class and tests are 75% of your final grade. I took his honors section and it is taught like the regular with a lower curve! AVOID!!!

Do not take him, there is honestly a good chance you will fail. Tests are fill in the blank and he's an extremely tough grader. His lectures are beyond boring and his voice starts to drain you after awhile. If I could, I would ask KSU for a refund after taking this class. Horrible experience. Horrible professor. Horrible environment. DO NOT TAKE!!!
BEST PROFESSOR AT KENNESAW STATE. TAKE HIM IF YOU WANT AN EASY A!!!
It's true that each exam has around 5 students making an A on it. You need to work for it to make a good grade.

He presents his class results after each test and on both tests out of 66 students he has awarded 2 A's and ranging from 6-10 B's. 44 students failed the first test. Be prepared to work. It's a hard subject.

I was advised not to take this course but I didn't listen. I thought I could do it if I read all the chapters, came to class, and studied everything he gave us. I was wrong. I had to drop the class after making a 48 on the first exam. I did everything I could to prepare for the tests but they're nothing like the notes or lectures.

Horrible class and worst professor ever. Don't bother going to his office, he is no help at all. Over half of the class dropped after the first test. This is a hard class, he sees students struggling but seems like not to care about it. Most of the class failed on the first test, and his suggestion was for us to drop the class. DO NOT TAKE HIM.

Ok, I have NEVER rated a professor before but I felt this was necessary. This was by far the worst professor I've ever had. The tests are impossible and nothing like the homework given. Don't bother asking questions, he doesnt help you. I dropped after the first test, over half of the class failed.. that includes a 10 point curve. SERIOUSLY, DONT.
Worst professor I've ever had... 42 people got less than a 69 on the first test and it had a ten point curve. Sat there and told us we were gonna fail from the get go. Don't waste your time.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS BECAUSE ITS THE MOST STRESSFUL CLASS EVER. I HAVE NEVER FAILED A CLASS IN MY LIFE. I WAS SO STRESSED OUT AND MATERIAL IS NOT THE SAME AS THE TEST. THE TESTS ARE FILL IN THE BLACK. PLEASE AVOID THIS PROFESSOR IF YOU LOVE YOUR LIFE AND DONT WANT TO FAIL. THIS COMES FROM A 3.8 GPA STUDENT.
4 grades, 3 tests and your hw average all count for 25% of your grade. Test are extremely difficult and his lectures are beyond boring. Avoid at all cost!!! Didn't learn a thing

I dont think the rating system works for this class. I think he is a good teacher and this is a very useful class. He is a good lecturer and the homework helps a lot. There is a lot of math and you need to get comfortable with it. Tests are harder than any material provided to you which is unpleasant.  An A requires effort no matter how smart u are
This class is extremely hard to get an A in.

This class is awful. He is really hard. You have three tests and he grades so hard. I always get A's and B's but not in here! I busted my butt for this class. He is the hardest teacher I've ever had. Don't take him if you need a good grade

Yes, Dr. Schwartz is a challenging professor - but if you are an Econ or Finance major, I would take him for any courses you can.  He will prepare you well for other classes.  If you are going to take Econ 4510, I would recommend taking Dr. Lewin for Math 1190 (Calculus).  The testing styles in the two courses are very similar.

Very challenging class. Knowledge in calculus is mandatory in order to be successful in the class. Weekly assignments are tough as well, but will help you grasp the material. If you overcome these hurdles and take on the challenge you will feel very accomplished. I obtained an A, however many in the class did very poorly and/or dropped the course.

Put in 4-5 hours a week into this class and you will receive an A.  Yes there is homework and even more if you decide to do it.  If you complete optional assignments you will know the material as well as the test.  He does get off track in lecture but his stories are a nice break from the subject of economics.

Read the chapter before attending his lectures and you'll find his presentations to be quite clear, this is not high school economics.  Plenty of resources are offered by him for those who study.  If you put 4-5 hours a week into this class you will get an A.
Class is  super boring. I dont like the way he teaches. He isn't very good at explaining things. I would find any other teacher thats available.

This was an extremely hard class. He is NOT a good professor & I think he made this class harder than it should have been. The test were nothing like the his practice exams & he always threw a trick question in. DO NOT take this class if you are not good with economics or calculus!!!!

This teacher is not very good. He goes off topic and losses students quickly. Class was so boring, I never wanted to go even though I still attended. He presented the material well but did not explain it well. I got my first C ever in college and I am an A student.

He has a unique sense of humor that seems unintentional and keeps the class interesting. Definitely interested in helping students out and making sure they understand the material. Lots of algebra and some calculus, but nothing ridiculous. Asks brief discussion-type questions on tests and homework to make sure you can interpret the results.

This class is for students who are serious about Economics. Dr. Schwartz is passionate about what he teaches and knows the material inside and out. If you are interested in just getting by, do not take his class. Grades are earned and not given. Although attendance is not mandatory, it is highly recommended. His lectures are thoughtful/insightful.

HOMEWORK. HOMEWORK. HOMEWORK. If you do the homework in this class, the homework grade will replace your lowest test grade. He's smart, but that makes him hard to follow sometimes. I studied my tush off and squeaked by with a c thanks to doing my homework- it literally saved my grade!

I highly recommend Prof Schwartz if you are willing to go to class and do the homework. He is clear, interesting and is passionate about what he is teaching. He really tries to encourage participation. If you want an easy A, dont take him. If you actually want to learn something, take him!

Getting a good grade in this class takes 2 things. 1. Show up 2. Do the homework. A majority of the people who complain about this class never show up or attempt the homework. He is a very fair teacher and curves on exams. No cumulative final. Exam problems very similar to homework problems and practice tests. Must have grasp of basic college alg.

This class is NOT hard if you go to class, take notes, and do the homework. Really nice and always willing to help. Can be confusing at times, but generally not a tough prof. It's obvious he's obsessed with economics. 3 tests, and a HW due every week. Definitely take this class if you want to learn basic econ and if you're not a slacker! Take him!
HE IS GOOD TEACHER. IF YOU STUDY HARD AND DO GOOD HIS HOMEWORKS.AND REVIEW HIS LECTURES CAREFULLY, YOU WILL TAKE B OR A.

very great teacher, english is my 2nd language but i had no trouble understanding the material of the course, he knows the subject very well and there is no surprises in the tests, i would recommand him 100%.

Good teacher, a little strict but he is good at presenting the information and explaining it.  Seems complicated at first but everything eventually makes sense.  You need to go to class, do the homework and read the book to do well.  I was only slightly interested in the topic but he made it easy to learn.  He's quirky and has lame jokes.  Good guy
Don't take this class if you aren't comfortable with algebra and some calculus, you will struggle.
Awful.. do not take him.
DO NOT TAKE. Ive always made A's and rarely B's and had troubles just passing the homework assignment. Failed first test. Had to drop it. His lectures are  horribly to sit through. Very tough class.
Very complicated. I Couldn't understand his lectures. Homework and tests were hard. He could not teach very well. Boring class. I wouldn't recommend him to a friend.

One of my favorite professors and I am not a business major!! I had him for 2100 and 4510. The class is not easy but he explains things rather well. His tests are hard because he expects you to know things even if he changes the variables a little. He is always available for help and hw is 25% of your grade so do it because it is basically the test

The class was kinda tough, but I really liked him. He explained things clearly and was thorough. He's a total nerd, but gets funnier further into the semester. I definitely recommend taking a class from him!

Good teacher, funny smart, and will teach what you need to know. tests come fromhis in class notes and some overview form the book. class attendence not required but it helps. tests come from his in-class notes. funny and easy B if you study that morning. study 2-3 more hours and get an A.

This is the first time using this web site, but I need to WARN everyone about this prof. Schwartz is EASILY THE WORST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD..PERIOD. His tests don't cover what you THINK will be on the tests. He makes you do homework BEFORE explaining it you..then grades it strictly. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS IF YOU VALUE YOUR GPA!! SERIOUS!!

I didn't really like this class at all. I thought it was super boring. To check attendance, he has daily homework, which is fine. I did the homework and did well, but I ended up failing most of the tests. I couldn't figure out why when the homework was supposed to be the same stuff. I ended up failing the class.

The Prof is very unhelpful. He does not explain whenever one has a question. His is very full of himself. He thinks his students should know everything. If I am suppose to know everything then why is he still in the teaching profession. Avoid taking his classes if you can. It not worth the stress at all.
No Comments
teaches well, provides good notes on lectures, very helpful study guides for tests; adds bonus points to tests

He is not easy nor difficult. To me he explains things better than the book. My recommendation is to go to class do the homework assigments and get the study guide. He is the best economics teacher, I have ever had. Take him if you want a passing grade.
He is a total geek.  He gets extremely excited about the stupidest stories of his life.  However, his class is very easy.  I slept through most of the classes I went to and still made an A.
difficult yet fair.  Door always open for student questions, comments and concerns.  Tests are fair and grading very fair.  Love to have him for other course.
